info.title: Firecrawl API
info.description: API for interacting with Firecrawl services to perform web scraping and crawling tasks.

post.summary: Scrape a single URL and optionally extract information using an LLM

error.example: Payment required to access this resource.
Request rate limit exceeded. Please wait and try again later.
An unexpected error occurred on the server.

post.summary: Scrape multiple URLs and optionally extract information using an LLM

url.description: The URL to send the webhook to. This will trigger for batch scrape started (batch_scrape.started), every page scraped (batch_scrape.page) and when the batch scrape is completed (batch_scrape.completed or batch_scrape.failed). The response will be the same as the `/scrape` endpoint.

headers.description: Headers to send to the webhook URL.

metadata.description: Custom metadata that will be included in all webhook payloads for this crawl

events.description: Type of events that should be sent to the webhook URL. (default: all)

ignoreInvalidURLs.description: If invalid URLs are specified in the urls array, they will be ignored. Instead of them failing the entire request, a batch scrape using the remaining valid URLs will be created, and the invalid URLs will be returned in the invalidURLs field of the response.

error.example: Payment required to access this resource.
Request rate limit exceeded. Please wait and try again later.
An unexpected error occurred on the server.

post.summary: Crawl multiple URLs based on options

url.description: The base URL to start crawling from

excludePaths.description: URL pathname regex patterns that exclude matching URLs from the crawl. For example, if you set "excludePaths": ["blog/.*"] for the base URL firecrawl.dev, any results matching that pattern will be excluded, such as https://www.firecrawl.dev/blog/firecrawl-launch-week-1-recap.

includePaths.description: URL pathname regex patterns that include matching URLs in the crawl. Only the paths that match the specified patterns will be included in the response. For example, if you set "includePaths": ["blog/.*"] for the base URL firecrawl.dev, only results matching that pattern will be included, such as https://www.firecrawl.dev/blog/firecrawl-launch-week-1-recap.

maxDepth.description: Maximum depth to crawl relative to the base URL. Basically, the max number of slashes the pathname of a scraped URL may contain.

maxDiscoveryDepth.description: Maximum depth to crawl based on discovery order. The root site and sitemapped pages has a discovery depth of 0. For example, if you set it to 1, and you set ignoreSitemap, you will only crawl the entered URL and all URLs that are linked on that page.

ignoreSitemap.description: Ignore the website sitemap when crawling

ignoreQueryParameters.description: Do not re-scrape the same path with different (or none) query parameters

limit.description: Maximum number of pages to crawl. Default limit is 10000.

allowBackwardLinks.description:
Allows the crawler to follow internal links to sibling or parent URLs, not just child paths.

false: Only crawls deeper (child) URLs.
→ e.g. /features/feature-1 → /features/feature-1/tips ✅
→ Won't follow /pricing or / ❌

true: Crawls any internal links, including siblings and parents.
→ e.g. /features/feature-1 → /pricing, /, etc. ✅

Use true for broader internal coverage beyond nested paths.

allowExternalLinks.description: Allows the crawler to follow links to external websites.

delay.description: Delay in seconds between scrapes. This helps respect website rate limits.

url.description: The URL to send the webhook to. This will trigger for crawl started (crawl.started), every page crawled (crawl.page) and when the crawl is completed (crawl.completed or crawl.failed). The response will be the same as the `/scrape` endpoint.

headers.description: Headers to send to the webhook URL.

metadata.description: Custom metadata that will be included in all webhook payloads for this crawl

events.description: Type of events that should be sent to the webhook URL. (default: all)

error.example: Payment required to access this resource.
Request rate limit exceeded. Please wait and try again later.
An unexpected error occurred on the server.

post.summary: Map multiple URLs based on options

url.description: The base URL to start crawling from

search.description: Search query to use for mapping. During the Alpha phase, the 'smart' part of the search functionality is limited to 1000 search results. However, if map finds more results, there is no limit applied.

ignoreSitemap.description: Ignore the website sitemap when crawling.

sitemapOnly.description: Only return links found in the website sitemap

limit.description: Maximum number of links to return

timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds. There is no timeout by default.

error.example: Payment required to access this resource.
Request rate limit exceeded. Please wait and try again later.
An unexpected error occurred on the server.

post.summary: Extract structured data from pages using LLMs

items.description: The URLs to extract data from. URLs should be in glob format.

prompt.description: Prompt to guide the extraction process

schema.description: Schema to define the structure of the extracted data. Must conform to [JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org/).

enableWebSearch.description: When true, the extraction will use web search to find additional data

ignoreSitemap.description: When true, sitemap.xml files will be ignored during website scanning

includeSubdomains.description: When true, subdomains of the provided URLs will also be scanned

showSources.description: When true, the sources used to extract the data will be included in the response as `sources` key

ignoreInvalidURLs.description: If invalid URLs are specified in the urls array, they will be ignored. Instead of them failing the entire request, an extract using the remaining valid URLs will be performed, and the invalid URLs will be returned in the invalidURLs field of the response.

error.example: Invalid input data.
An unexpected error occurred on the server.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the extract job

get.summary: Get the status of an extract job
Get all active crawls for the authenticated team

id.description: The unique identifier of the crawl

teamId.description: The ID of the team that owns the crawl

url.description: The origin URL of the crawl

options.description: The crawler options used for this crawl

error.example: Payment required to access this resource.
Request rate limit exceeded. Please wait and try again later.
An unexpected error occurred on the server.

post.summary: Start a deep research operation on a query

maxUrls.description: Maximum number of URLs to analyze

analysisPrompt.description: The prompt to use for the final analysis. Useful to format the final analysis markdown in a specific way.

systemPrompt.description: The system prompt to use for the research agent. Useful to steer the research agent to a specific direction.

schema.description: The schema to use for the JSON output. Must conform to [JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org/).

systemPrompt.description: The system prompt to use for the JSON output

prompt.description: The prompt to use for the JSON output

error.example: Invalid parameters provided

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the research job

get.summary: Get the status and results of a deep research operation

error.example: Research job not found

get.summary: Get remaining credits for the authenticated team

remaining_credits.description: Number of credits remaining for the team

error.example: Could not find credit usage information
Internal server error while fetching credit usage

get.summary: Get remaining tokens for the authenticated team (Extract only)

remaining_tokens.description: Number of tokens remaining for the team

error.example: Could not find token usage information

post.summary: Search and optionally scrape search results

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

ignoreInvalidURLs.description: Excludes URLs from the search results that are invalid for other Firecrawl endpoints. This helps reduce errors if you are piping data from search into other Firecrawl API endpoints.

formats.description: Formats to include in the output

markdown.description: Markdown content if scraping was requested

html.description: HTML content if requested in formats

rawHtml.description: Raw HTML content if requested in formats

links.description: Links found if requested in formats

screenshot.description: Screenshot URL if requested in formats

warning.description: Warning message if any issues occurred

error.example: Request timed out
An unexpected error occurred on the server.

url.description: The URL to generate LLMs.txt from

maxUrls.description: Maximum number of URLs to analyze

showFullText.description: Include full text content in the response

id.description: ID of the LLMs.txt generation job

error.example: Invalid parameters provided

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the LLMs.txt generation job

get.summary: Get the status and results of an LLMs.txt generation job

llmsfulltxt.description: The full text content when showFullText is true

expiresAt.description: When the generated content will expire

error.example: LLMs.txt generation job not found

formats.description: Formats to include in the output.

onlyMainContent.description: Only return the main content of the page excluding headers, navs, footers, etc.

includeTags.description: Tags to include in the output.

excludeTags.description: Tags to exclude from the output.

maxAge.description: Returns a cached version of the page if it is younger than this age in milliseconds. If a cached version of the page is older than this value, the page will be scraped. If you do not need extremely fresh data, enabling this can speed up your scrapes by 500%. Defaults to 0, which disables caching.

headers.description: Headers to send with the request. Can be used to send cookies, user-agent, etc.

waitFor.description: Specify a delay in milliseconds before fetching the content, allowing the page sufficient time to load.

mobile.description: Set to true if you want to emulate scraping from a mobile device. Useful for testing responsive pages and taking mobile screenshots.

skipTlsVerification.description: Skip TLS certificate verification when making requests

timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for the request

parsePDF.description: Controls how PDF files are processed during scraping. When true, the PDF content is extracted and converted to markdown format, with billing based on the number of pages (1 credit per page). When false, the PDF file is returned in base64 encoding with a flat rate of 1 credit total.

schema.description: The schema to use for the extraction (Optional). Must conform to [JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org/).

systemPrompt.description: The system prompt to use for the extraction (Optional)

prompt.description: The prompt to use for the extraction without a schema (Optional)

actions.description: Actions to perform on the page before grabbing the content

type.description: Wait for a specified amount of milliseconds

selector.description: Query selector to find the element by

type.description: Take a screenshot. The links will be in the response's `actions.screenshots` array.

fullPage.description: Should the screenshot be full-page or viewport sized?

selector.description: Query selector to find the element by

all.description: Clicks all elements matched by the selector, not just the first one. Does not throw an error if no elements match the selector.

type.description: Write text into an input field, text area, or contenteditable element. Note: You must first focus the element using a 'click' action before writing. The text will be typed character by character to simulate keyboard input.

oneOf.title: Press a key
oneOf.description: Press a key on the page. See https://asawicki.info/nosense/doc/devices/keyboard/key_codes.html for key codes.

type.description: Press a key on the page
Scroll the page or a specific element

selector.description: Query selector for the element to scroll

type.description: Scrape the current page content, returns the url and the html.
Execute JavaScript code on the page

location.description: Location settings for the request. When specified, this will use an appropriate proxy if available and emulate the corresponding language and timezone settings. Defaults to 'US' if not specified.

languages.description: Preferred languages and locales for the request in order of priority. Defaults to the language of the specified location. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Accept-Language

removeBase64Images.description: Removes all base 64 images from the output, which may be overwhelmingly long. The image's alt text remains in the output, but the URL is replaced with a placeholder.

blockAds.description: Enables ad-blocking and cookie popup blocking.

proxy.description:
Specifies the type of proxy to use.

 - **basic**: Proxies for scraping sites with none to basic anti-bot solutions. Fast and usually works.
 - **stealth**: Stealth proxies for scraping sites with advanced anti-bot solutions. Slower, but more reliable on certain sites. Costs up to 5 credits per request.
 - **auto**: Firecrawl will automatically retry scraping with stealth proxies if the basic proxy fails. If the retry with stealth is successful, 5 credits will be billed for the scrape. If the first attempt with basic is successful, only the regular cost will be billed.

If you do not specify a proxy, Firecrawl will default to basic.

changeTrackingOptions.description: Options for change tracking (Beta). Only applicable when 'changeTracking' is included in formats. The 'markdown' format must also be specified when using change tracking.

modes.description: The mode to use for change tracking. 'git-diff' provides a detailed diff, and 'json' compares extracted JSON data.

schema.description: Schema for JSON extraction when using 'json' mode. Defines the structure of data to extract and compare. Must conform to [JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org/).

prompt.description: Prompt to use for change tracking when using 'json' mode. If not provided, the default prompt will be used.

tag.description: Tag to use for change tracking. Tags can separate change tracking history into separate "branches", where change tracking with a specific tagwill only compare to scrapes made in the same tag. If not provided, the default tag (null) will be used.

storeInCache.description: If true, the page will be stored in the Firecrawl index and cache. Setting this to false is useful if your scraping activity may have data protection concerns. Using some parameters associated with sensitive scraping (actions, headers) will force this parameter to be false.

html.description: HTML version of the content on page if `html` is in `formats`

rawHtml.description: Raw HTML content of the page if `rawHtml` is in `formats`

screenshot.description: Screenshot of the page if `screenshot` is in `formats`

links.description: List of links on the page if `links` is in `formats`

actions.description: Results of the actions specified in the `actions` parameter. Only present if the `actions` parameter was provided in the request

screenshots.description: Screenshot URLs, in the same order as the screenshot actions provided.

scrapes.description: Scrape contents, in the same order as the scrape actions provided.

javascriptReturns.description: JavaScript return values, in the same order as the executeJavascript actions provided.

statusCode.description: The status code of the page

error.description: The error message of the page

llm_extraction.description: Displayed when using LLM Extraction. Extracted data from the page following the schema defined.

warning.description: Can be displayed when using LLM Extraction. Warning message will let you know any issues with the extraction.

changeTracking.description: Change tracking information if `changeTracking` is in `formats`. Only present when the `changeTracking` format is requested.

previousScrapeAt.description: The timestamp of the previous scrape that the current page is being compared against. Null if no previous scrape exists.

changeStatus.description: The result of the comparison between the two page versions. 'new' means this page did not exist before, 'same' means content has not changed, 'changed' means content has changed, 'removed' means the page was removed.

visibility.description: The visibility of the current page/URL. 'visible' means the URL was discovered through an organic route (links or sitemap), 'hidden' means the URL was discovered through memory from previous crawls.

diff.description: Git-style diff of changes when using 'git-diff' mode. Only present when the mode is set to 'git-diff'.

json.description: JSON comparison results when using 'json' mode. Only present when the mode is set to 'json'. This will emit a list of all the keys and their values from the `previous` and `current` scrapes based on the type defined in the `schema`. Example [here](/features/change-tracking)

status.description: The current status of the crawl. Can be `scraping`, `completed`, or `failed`.

total.description: The total number of pages that were attempted to be crawled.

completed.description: The number of pages that have been successfully crawled.

creditsUsed.description: The number of credits used for the crawl.

expiresAt.description: The date and time when the crawl will expire.

next.description: The URL to retrieve the next 10MB of data. Returned if the crawl is not completed or if the response is larger than 10MB.

html.description: HTML version of the content on page if `includeHtml`  is true

rawHtml.description: Raw HTML content of the page if `includeRawHtml`  is true

links.description: List of links on the page if `includeLinks` is true

screenshot.description: Screenshot of the page if `includeScreenshot` is true

statusCode.description: The status code of the page

error.description: The error message of the page

errors.description: Errored scrape jobs and error details

robotsBlocked.description: List of URLs that were attempted in scraping but were blocked by robots.txt

status.description: The current status of the batch scrape. Can be `scraping`, `completed`, or `failed`.

total.description: The total number of pages that were attempted to be scraped.

completed.description: The number of pages that have been successfully scraped.

creditsUsed.description: The number of credits used for the batch scrape.

expiresAt.description: The date and time when the batch scrape will expire.

next.description: The URL to retrieve the next 10MB of data. Returned if the batch scrape is not completed or if the response is larger than 10MB.

data.description: The data of the batch scrape.

html.description: HTML version of the content on page if `includeHtml`  is true

rawHtml.description: Raw HTML content of the page if `includeRawHtml`  is true

links.description: List of links on the page if `includeLinks` is true

screenshot.description: Screenshot of the page if `includeScreenshot` is true

statusCode.description: The status code of the page

error.description: The error message of the page

invalidURLs.description: If ignoreInvalidURLs is true, this is an array containing the invalid URLs that were specified in the request. If there were no invalid URLs, this will be an empty array. If ignoreInvalidURLs is false, this field will be undefined.

If ignoreInvalidURLs is true, this is an array containing the invalid URLs that were specified in the request. If there were no invalid URLs, this will be an empty array. If ignoreInvalidURLs is false, this field will be undefined.

status.description: The current status of the extract job
